official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide
		  veterans with a 1-year exemption from the requirement to maintain minimum
		  essential coverage under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care
		  Act.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Fairness for America’s Heroes Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
1-year exemption for
			 veterans from individual mandate under Patient Protection and Affordable Care
			 Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following
			 new paragraph:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 5000A(e) of
			 the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

term.#tail:
means an individual who served
				on active duty (other than active duty for training) in the Armed Forces of the
				United States and has been discharged or released from active duty in the Armed
				Forces of the United States under conditions other than
				dishonorable.

text.#text:
Any applicable individual for any month
				beginning before January 1, 2015, if the individual is a veteran. For purposes
				of this paragraph, the term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall take effect as if
			 included in the amendments made by
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fairness for America’s Heroes Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 1501 of the Patient Protection and
			 Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1501

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2876 IH: Fairness for America’s Heroes Act of 2013
